messages.content: What is the main purpose of ComfyUI-TGu-utils?
ComfyUI-TGu-utils is a set of custom nodes for ComfyUI that mainly focuses on control switches.
Who is the author of ComfyUI-TGu-utils?
The author of ComfyUI-TGu-utils is TGu-97.
What does the LoRA Switch node in ComfyUI-TGu-utils do?
The LoRA Switch node in ComfyUI-TGu-utils controls whether a LoRA Loader and its corresponding trigger prompts will be included in the queue.
What are the inputs required for the LoRA Switch node?

The inputs required for the LoRA Switch node are: model1 (the original model), condition1 (the original condition), model2 (the original model + LoRA), and condition2 (the original condition + LoRA prompts, using Conditioning (Combine) or Conditioning (Concat)).
What does the LoRA Switch node output when the switch is OFF?
When the LoRA Switch is OFF, it outputs model1 and conditioning1.
What does the LoRA Switch node output when the switch is ON?
When the LoRA Switch is ON, it outputs model2 and conditioning2.
How can you combine or concatenate conditions in the LoRA Switch node?
You can combine or concatenate conditions in the LoRA Switch node using Conditioning (Combine) or Conditioning (Concat).
